Text.val: XML Validate returns TRUE if the XML is ok
Delete out existing errors in the error table. This table is used as a generic
place to hold lists returned by vectors.
XMLValidationError() returns a vector of error messages
Loop through the Error Vector, making one table entry per error
Refresh the subform that displays the errors. The subform is only visible is

ExpSyntax.val: 'XM06: How Do I Modify an Existing XML Document?'

Text.val: Create each entry for the list for the user.
In this task the user can edit a local copy of the XML file
When the user presses Save, then the Blob is put back in the text file
